intro: Cnemidaria varians, commonly known as the variable grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and can vary in color depending on environmental conditions. Cnemidaria varians is known for its adaptability to arid climates and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
